Image pathway list

Image pathway list

Provide a standard pathway to content with a supporting image.

On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts
  • Examples and assets

Visual design

Design view:

Mobile design

Desktop designs can be viewed on screens wider than 650px.

Label

Image pathway list

The image pathway list is an in-page link to another page on the site with a supporting image.

CSS styles

Desktop

Heading
h3 {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    line-height: 28px;
}
h3:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    text-decoration: underline;
}
Label
p.label {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 12px;
    line-height: 20px;
    text-transform: uppercase;
}
Description
p.description {
    color: #000000;
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 14px;
    line-height: 24px;
}
Icon link
.icon {    
    color: #254F90;
    height: 16px;
    width: 16px;
}
.icon:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    height: 32px;
    width: 32px;
}
Container
.container {
    background: #FFFFFF;
    padding: 16px;
    border: none;
    border-top: 4px solid #254F90;
    box-shadow: 0 0.125rem 0.75rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
    transition-delay:0s;
    transition-duration:0.4s;
    transition-property:all;
    transition-timing-function:ease;
}
.container:hover {
    box-shadow: 0 0.25rem 0.5rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0,.2);
    transform: translateY(-4px);
}

Mobile

Description
p.description {
    font-size: 16px;
    line-height: 28px;
}

Guidelines for use

Purpose: 

The image pathway list component is used to provide pathways to a list of pages on the site, using tiles with a supporting image. It has an optional button below the image pathways. 

When to use this component: 

  • Image pathway components are commonly used on the home, news and customer story index pages. They provide navigation tiles (each with an image) to a list of similar page types (such as news articles or customer stories).  
  • Image pathways may also be used on content pages for priority 2 tasks (for example, to list customer stories for a particular grant). 

Content rules: 

  • Display description for each item. 
  • Do not display content type label, except on news index page. 
  • No alt text for pathway images. 

Layouts

Page layouts

Image pathway list components can be used in full width and 2/3rd width pages.

Component layout options

Equal width layout (on full width pages)

Desktop: Three equal width components in a row.

Tablet: Two equal width components in a row.

Mobile: One equal component in a row.

Equal width layout (on 2/3rd width pages)

Desktop & tablet: Two equal width components in a row.

Mobile: One equal component in a row.
